S.FORM: mapitu wagi' tehuk cu papasba'an ci ke' soni'.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: palapuw la. maṟuk lalapgan ci patas ka sinsi'. “tatuli', pastukung” ma ka pancang.
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: yotas ka ke' min maha; “sinsi' ramas su'.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: lunpuw patas ci kaca ga, pasba'an mini lalapuw ci ke' na itaṟal ni sinsi'.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Atayal language of numbers.

S.FORM: gunluw min lunpuw sinsi'. mawas min ci awas na lalapuw uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: payux ka ke' na itaṟal wal mu ba'un.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Atayal languages.

S.FORM: musa' cu papasba'an ci ke' karirex. sunbaba' cu ci ke' na itaṟal karirex. papungan mu yayan mu.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Atayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Pawan ka ralu' mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Pawan。
My name is Pawan.

S.FORM: Watan ka ralu' ni yaba' mu.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Watan。
My dad’s name is Watan.

S.FORM: Temi ka ralu' ni yaya' mu.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Temi。
My mother’s name is Temi.

S.FORM: malapṟow ka ingkaṟalan mu.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: kelan cu tutux na asuṟan malikuṟ, Iyung ka ralu' ni, malapṟow utux ingkaṟalan ni.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Iyung，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Iyung, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: cel min magaluw lunpuw patas utux papasba'an ci ke'.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: sunkisli' min mawas kora' cami ci asuṟan mu malikuṟ.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: sunkisli' cu lumanguy. mahnguw ci kaca, magaluw min musa' lumanguy utux min moṟow.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: sunkisli' cu sunrangi', anak min magaluw mawas lu lumanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: ule' cu na Itaṟal kung.
S.TRANSL: 我是泰雅族的小孩。
I am an Atayal child.

S.FORM: cel maki Sasi' ka moṟow mu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在Sasi’。
Our family lives in Sasi’.

S.FORM: ṟamagal ci'uli' kora' moṟow mu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tugal min macsuse'.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: magaluw cu maki' ci yaba', yaya', asuṟan malikuṟ lu asuṟan kanel mu.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: babawi' ka yaba' mu, kensacu ka hiya'.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mahikang ka yaya' mu, ising ka hiya'.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: maki' moṟow ka yaba' ga, makake' min ci ke' na itṟal.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Atayal language with us at home.

S.FORM: mahnguw min papasba'an ci ke' ga, musa' min alang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: magaluw min kunṟak apatuṟ ci asuṟan mu.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: kisli' mu caṟung ka utux moṟow mu.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: musa' min salahaw ci yaya' mu soni'.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: pascex ka kaṟal bawi'. ini' kagahṟa' lu kakilux ka kaṟal uṟi, bale' sabihuṟan.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: me' min ci pang banux raxal ki. cumex hi' ka wagi', hulhul caṟung.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: gaben, matanah ka kaṟal la.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: kaṟalun mu ka yaya', hunco' matanah ka kaṟal la?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的？
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: ba'uw ta' unel haṟi' ka behuṟ la maka yaya'.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: ungat ṟaṟulung ka kaṟal malahngan, pakaṟek ka hangitux uṟi la.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: maha' min moṟow uṟi la.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: tu'uy a'usa moṟow, cumun cu ci hangitux.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: hita ini' awah ka behuṟ, makmusa cu salahaw na mikung.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: cel maki' syaw na moṟow mu ka papasba'an ci ke' mu, maskakiy cu karirex musa' papasba'an ci ke'. maskakiy cu moh moṟow uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ini' kayotas ka papasba'an ci ke' min, ini' kapayux ka seyto' uṟi. makakuba' min kora'.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: masasali' min patatalaman kora', magaluw min pasboru' lu mapatisal.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: magaluw salahaw caminan ka sinsi' uṟi, yona utux moṟow ka papasba'an ci ke'.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: sumopah min karirex, malabu' ka lalapgan sinpohan mim.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: umu' garasu' ruma, sumopah ruma.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: sapohan min kora' ka raṟi' na papasba'an ci ke'. bale' min mapuli' ci pumahun, malabu' karirex ka papasba'an ci ke'.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: minsa' min matisal yutasan alang hira'.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: buse' min ini' pakakatox la. lunlungun mu caṟung.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: matox kinang ka yutas ga, pakane'an cini ci sikwa lu pa'abon cini ci ocya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: cacibing ka sikwa pinmuhi' ni yutas. ramas caṟung ni'un.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: kisli' mu ka ocya' ni yutas uṟi, ramas caṟung abun.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: cakan na rex, magaluw cu pahpuy ci yaki' mu.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: lanlamu' ka tinahuk cakan rex ni yaki'. kelan na ucyux, gilung, tamurak lu tatacumuri'.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: minani' min cakan rex laga， musa' min magal ci ṟagu' ṟagu'an la.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: payux ka ngahi', cehuṟ, kucun bini' ni yaki', rasi moṟow ma.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: pasugagiy ta' la! moh cu matox cimunan babuw ni luṟi sun mu ka yaki'.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: rasun mini cika kakelan na asinuw nanahi' ni sinsi' soni'. matakaluw min miniy ci kipu balihun.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: maṟuk min cika kakelan na asinuw nanahi' laga, kumaṟal ka sinsi'; “galeng ga, kakabahni' kora', bukuy ga kuya', sahayuw nak matox kora' mamu.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mangugnu' cu ci kuya' kung. kani ka aṟat cu paktox ci kukuya'.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: payux ka kabahni' intaxan mu, cel mulaka' kahuni' bawi'. taxan mu ka kuṟ cel mabel baling kahuni' ki uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: kelan na zo, ramiy lu ngarux. aṟat cu mintox kinlalayan ci asinuw nanahi' yonani. ma'as cu caṟung soni'.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: payux ka sasing pinsasing mu. papaktox mu yaban lu yayan.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: babuw ni pagaluw cu yaba', yaya' mu moh luṟi.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: pahngagan rex hani, musa' min matox maman Taytong cami ci asuṟan mu kanel.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: pas'aring min Taypey tupanga' kisya' nanu' Taytong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: tehuk Taytong, maras ci ṟaṟulu' moh magal caminan ka mama'.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: ini' satuhya' ci moṟow ni mama' ka eki'. min_gagos tikiy pati'uṟit ci ṟaṟulu' laga tehuk la.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: kelan na banux wasti' ka syaw moṟow ni mama'. magaluw min paritensya' musa' banux ki.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: maki' banux, rasun mini rumanga' mit lu tupanga' ramiy ni mama'.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: malahngan, magaluw min musa' mani' ci mami' alang banux.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: payux la ṟaṟulu' ka alang banux. kani ka tupanga' min ci otobay musa' ki.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: pagiy min laga, wal kuri'un ka otobay la. maku min tupanga' ci basu' magiy ki.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: nel min tehuk Taypey micuw la. yani wal lon ka otobay ni mama' laga?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: yuyuk cu ci kaca, maki' Sasi' ka moṟow mu. lunpuw cu patas la ga, masuṟigal min Hori', maki' min alang banux nanu' micuw.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在Sasi’，上學以後，就搬到了埔里，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Sasi’. After I started school, we moved to Puli and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: musa' cu tase la ga, lunpuw cu patas gagaṟux na Itaṟal. kaca ka ba'un mu ci masinpayux ka gagaṟux na Yencumincu.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: kani ka. mahnguw lunpuw abagan pilaw hani. magaluw cu asuṟan mu malikuṟ musa' min panaṟit ci nabkis alang. mak ba'un min nak tikiy ka gagaṟux na alang min.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: maspat mapgan ka ingkaṟalan naka nabkis hani la. ho' ga, yona katana'an taxan na.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: ana amol na ke' ka ba'un su' sun mu. tahṟuti' caṟung ka ke' na Itaṟal ni. ba' ci ke' na Seediq, Taluw lu Tanah tunux.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的泰雅語說得很流利，也會說賽德克語、華語和日本語。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Seediq, Chinese and Japanese.

S.FORM: panaṟican mu, kaca ka ba'un mu ci saringan yuyuk sunbaba' ci ke' na “Tanah tunux.” ka hiya'. Seediq ka kanel ni, hungel ka Taluw kinuba'un ni mumaṟah. kani ka payux la ke' ba'un ni kumaṟal.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是賽德克族人，而他工作上認識許多華人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Seediq, and he knows many Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: makakaṟal min ci kaca ga, payux ka gagaṟux na maloṟak wal sikaṟal naka nabkis hani.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ana min wal ini' bayi haṟi mung ka ruma', ho' ga, wal min pasisingan na nawilung. anak sahyawan mung babuw ni.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: yuyuk cu ci kaca, ini' mu caṟung bayi ka gagaṟux mu. sikasaṟux mu ka ciragan mu uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: payux ka kinuba' mu la ga, tatirahu' mu galeng na ci'uli' ka cinragan mu Itaṟal hani,
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為泰雅族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tayal is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: unel moṟow kira' malahngan ka suse' malikuṟ la.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: musa' min miniy gilung babinaran ci yaki' mu. sunrama' ci nani'un gaben ni suse' malikuṟ.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: muke min babinaran ci ṟagu', payux ka ṟagu' nah na hinoṟak.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: miniy min ci tamana', kakuyas lu tolat.
S.TRANSL: 我們買高麗菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought Cabbage, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: kumaṟal ka Lawpan paginbiniy ci buy syaw ki; “cacibing ka saputu' lu nabahṟi' mu, biniy tikiy ga!
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: miniy min ci saputu' lu nabahṟi'.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: muke' min babinaran ci gilung ki, kumaṟal ka Lawpan; “amol ka binarun su'? maseng ci yaba' ka gilung soni', utux ga tugal kbhul.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: maskitu' caṟung ni yaki' la. panaṟit ci Lawpan maha, ya anak mahyuw tikiy.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: mahyuw caṟung la mi Lawpan. iya' hawi'i la ma.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kumaṟal kutux ka Lawpan syaw ki, awah miniy ci ucyux mu, yaba' ci mahyuw ka ucyux mu.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: miniy min ci gilung lu ucyux la. utux rakat ka raramat tinahuk min.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: buse' min mana', minakung ka kaṟal la.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: moh nawilung ka suse' malikuṟ maha, ini' pahnguw ka sapitay la. babuw pahngagan rex unel cu la.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: kumaṟal ka yaki'; talagay ka tinahuk la. sipalawa' moh mani' kora' laga ma.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: malawa' min ci raral lu rangi' moh magaluw mani' kingaben la.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: kelan cu tutux na intana'an, Yawi ka ralu' ni. ṟumungi' maras karirex ci angaya' ni.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Yawi，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Yawi, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: lunpuw min ci patas ga, kuncik ci papatas, papuṟut lu papatasan cika intana'an mu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: min'utux, minsa'ing, aṟat ga mintugal, pakacikan naha hang.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ho' ga, ṟakah la a'usa' ni. kuncik ci angaya' ga, ini' bah mubinah.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: kani ka ini' pakacik hiyan ka ci'uli' la.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: cel tutux rex, musa' min salahaw tanux kora' min.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: cacka na tu'uy, makmusa' mastanux ka Yawi, ho' ga, ṟumungi' maras ci kulabuy.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Yawi想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Yawi wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: kuncik kulabuy ci intana'an ni. ho' ga, cumik hiyan kora' ka laha, ini' cu nak aras uṟi sun naha.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: maku mangilis ka Yawi pintahlan ni. masang maha; hunco' mamu ini' pakacik ci kulabuy kinang!
S.TRANSL: Yawi急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Yawi burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: kumaṟal hiyan ka intana'an, ya ka ini' su' bah maras ka isu', pinkacik sinang ka angaya' ga, ini' su' pabinahi kora'.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: sasan, maṟabuna' tehuk papasba'an ci ke' ka Yawi, pabinahun ni mi' ci intana'an ni kora' ka angaya' kincikan ni la.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Yawi很早就到學校了，Yawi把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Yawi arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: mastukung ci intana'an ni ka Yawi maha: pa'aras cu nak ci angaya' babuw ni la. bahbah mamu caṟung, sumoṟal mamu pakacik ci angaya' kinang.
S.TRANSL: Yawi向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Yawi apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: mpulata' na ci'uli' alang ka yaba' mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: yuyuk cu ci kaca, musa maloṟak malahngan ka yaba' lu mama' mu, maras ci puting lu hapuni'.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: pascex kaṟal laga, nel maras ci asinuw binu' naha.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: ruma' nak ga, baṟok nanahi', arat ga ṟapit, tin_git magal ci pikureh uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: bali'un naha mapuli' balihun alang hang. a'apuli' naha ci ci'uli' alang.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: satanuxan mu karirex ka yaba' mu. maha cu gunluw hiyan musa' maloṟak.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: as ka yotas su' laga, kaca ka rarasun misu' la mi yaba'.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: ming ci luṟang kunṟak ci asinuw nanahi' ka malikuṟ alang. ba' sunbale' ci binong lu katu'.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: ba' caṟung sunbale ci binong ka yaba' mu. kumaṟal ka yaba' mu, sikaṟak ci pikureh kani. as ka bali'un ta' matox ka pinkakayan na asinuw. pacin pinkakayan ni ki ka binong ma.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: umixul cu nahaṟi' musa' magaluw maloṟak ci nabkis, sunbaba' cu sunbale' ci binong karirex. ini' kabuse', kunṟak cubay ci asinuw nanahi' ka binong mu la.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: matox kinang ka yaba' ga, kumaṟal maha; maha su' mananang na mpulata' ka isu' babuw ni.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: yotas cu micuw la, mapanga' cu ci bahuni' lu panelu', magaluw cu yaban musa' maloṟak.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: tehuk cu alang laga, apulin mu ci ci'uli' alang ka asinuw mu.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: kumaṟal ka yaba' mu maha; pa'asun ka kinnabkisan mi' ci kinramas itan. kani ka payux la asinuw nanahi' inagal ta'.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: sunṟahu' cu musa' papasba'an ci ke' sasan la.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: musa' papasba'an ci ke' ci kaca ga, ṟumungi' cu maras ci kabang la.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ini' cu aras ana amol.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: lunpuw min ci kaca ga, magluw cu matox patas intana'an mu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: macacapung ci kaca ga, kuncik cu papatas laha ci papuṟut ni intana'an mu.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kumaṟal kinang ka sinsi' maha, “aṟbuna' haṟi matatuli' babuw ni, iya' saṟahu' la.”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Yawi ralu' naka rangi' mu caṟung, ule' na Itaṟal ka hiya' uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Yawi，他也是泰雅族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Yawi, and he is also an Tayal child.

S.FORM: magaluw min lunpuw alang Plngawan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在萬大部落讀書。
We study together in the Plngawan tribe.

S.FORM: magaluw min manapung kumaṟal ci insa' na nabkis rali' cika nabkis alang. ba' min kumaṟal caṟung ci ke' na Itaṟal.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說泰雅語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

S.FORM: babawi' ci katuhuṟ cu kung, mahikang ci lalabu' ka Yawi'.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Yawi很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Yawi is short and thin.

S.FORM: matakalang caṟung ka Yawi, kisli' naha caṟung.
S.TRANSL: Yawi很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Yawi is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: macacapung matatalang soni' ka papasba'an ci ke', lanlamu' la pacapngan sinrama' na papasba'an ci ke'.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: kelan na mahahuluy, kunlakah boru', matatalang, maṟuy lu cunbu panelu'.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: macacapung cu matatalang.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: matatalang cu ci kaca ga, matakuṟ cu, masramuṟux ka tari' mu la.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ho' ga, matatuli' cu tumalang na.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: tehuk cu puting laga, ma'as matox kora' ka ci'uli'.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ana cu ini' agal galeng, ga, ma'as cu, yaka matumasu' cu macacapung la.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: minsa' min matisal maman cami ci yaba' hira'.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: ma'ilis ka papak ni mama' la.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kumaṟal caminan ka hiya', kelan tutux na baling ka ramu'uy ma.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: sunbale' ramu'uy ci kaca ka hiya' ga, minoh ramu'uy bawi' mastuw la.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: siaras ci asinuw wanux lu binro ni yaba' ka mama'.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: mapatisal min abelan ci mama', payux ka ke' kinaṟal ni.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: pagiy cu ci kaca ga, babawi' su' la, muṟaṟing su' mabatunux uṟi la mi mama' mu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: kumaṟal cu maman mu; “bale' ka papak su' laga, awah matisal moṟow min babuw ni uṟi la sun mu.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: 2022 ingkaṟalan ci kaca, wal tutux ka pinkaṟalang na Seyhu, anak patasan ci ralu' na itaṟal ka mibunsyo ta' ma.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: panaṟit cu cika se'eneng Temu Numa, buse' saṟe' Seyhu ci papatas ralu' nak na itaṟal ka hiya'.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Temu Numa。
I interviewed Temu Numa, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: masu' min makaṟal pahngagan rex hani ga, maha' cu malahang moṟow ni hiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: mapatisal min ci kaca ga, bale kumaṟal kinang ci inoh na ralu' ni. pakuba' ci tanmoṟow ni lu alang ni uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kaṟalun mu ka hiya', hunco' su' as ki yunagun matas ci ralu' na itaṟal ka ralu' su'? ṟakah ka pinatas rali' aw? sun mu.
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: kumaṟal kinang ka hiya', siagal ci hinṟang na ralu' taluw matas ka ralu' itaṟal ga, ini' pala'ulu' pungan ma. ruma' ci'uli' ga, Te sensung sun naha malawa'. maku mapapase ka ci'uli' mung.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Tie Xian Sheng

S.FORM: kumaṟal ka Temu Numa maha; patasan nak ci ralu' itaṟal ka ralu' ta' ga, kaca ka ita' nak caṟung. pinkegal ci lahuṟ itaṟal, tanmoṟow, lu cinragan ta'. hita' ta' mulu' nak ci ralu' ta' kora' ita' itaṟal.
S.TRANSL: our family
Temu Numa said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: gunluw cu yaken mu hira' musa' cika babainaran. maras ci lanlamu' na ṟagu' pinmuhi' ni nak. tumahuk ci nani'un halan ni maginbiniy uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: kisli' naha ka babinaran ni yaki' ki. payux ci'uli' miniy ka urik lu nasubi' ni, habaṟaw ci'uli' moh tumalang mani' ci tinahuk ni uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: ramas caṟung ni'un ka aṟingu' singut lu rangil tinahuk ni. kelan na asinuw baṟowk nanahi' pinahnuk na ma'uw uṟi. as rong ci ci'uli ka sinkanaxan ni, moh matikaluw babinaran min kora' naha.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的樹豆湯和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的山胡椒滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

The pigeon pea soup and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: tumahuk ci nani'un ka yaki' hang ga, tapeh cu ci ci'uli' sisyaw kung. yotas ka ke' mu maha, “pinmuhi' min nak ka ṟagu' hani. aṟat pinle'an ci ayu'. nahaṟi' moh miniy!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: mingagos tikiy, masu' min maginbiniy la. kumaṟal ka yaki' mu maha, “utux ci isu' ka rumow la,” ma.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: inohan min hani ga, wal mu ba'un caṟung ka pinmuhi' lu kinuba' ci nani'un na itaṟal la. ba'un mu kora' ka abuk na paginbiniy uṟi la.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: taxan mu yonani sunkisli' nak ci nani'un na kinnabkisan rali' ka yaki' mu ga, maku patatiṟuw lu tirahu' ka linlungan mu.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
